what: Borehole Drilling and Construction Data – Malawi, 2018 - 2024
title: Borehole Drilling and Construction Data – Malawi, 2018 - 2024
text: dataset captures detailed information borehole drilling construction activities conducted across selected sites Malawi 2018 2024. Data collected using mWater digital platform, documenting stage groundwater development, site selection hydrogeological studies drilling operations, borehole design, post-construction assessments. dataset includes variables location site suitability, survey geophysical methods, drilling parameters, equipment safety compliance, geological formations encountered, casing gravel pack details, initial water quality measurements. Together, data provide comprehensive technical record Malawi’s borehole development process. Potential Use Cases dataset valuable wide range stakeholders, including: Government Water Departments District Councils: monitoring drilling quality, verifying contractor performance, maintaining updated inventory functional water points. Development Partners NGOs: planning new water supply interventions, assessing borehole performance, improving accountability donor-funded projects. Hydrogeologists WASH Engineers: analyzing aquifer characteristics, drilling efficiency, relationship geology borehole productivity. Researchers Academic Institutions: studying groundwater development practices, environmental sustainability, data-driven approaches rural water supply. Policy Makers Regulators: strengthening national standards, promoting data transparency, improving decision-making water resources sector.

code: library(drillingdata)  # Histogram of Borehole Depths # Load required packages library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # prepare data boreholes_clean <- drillingdata %>%   mutate(depth_m = as.numeric(borehole_depth_miters)) %>%   filter(!is.na(depth_m))  # remove missing values  # Plot graph ggplot(boreholes_clean, aes(x = depth_m)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 10, fill = "skyblue", color = "black", alpha = 0.8) +   labs(     title = "Distribution of Borehole Depths",     subtitle = "Number of boreholes in different depth ranges",     x = "Borehole Depth (meters)",     y = "Number of Boreholes"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 14)
